newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Bovespa index to be shortened today.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Bovespa index to be shortened today.

text.p: Sao Paulo bourse's Bovespa index will be one digit shorter as of today to make it easier for investors to follow the index, the stock exchange said.
The Bovespa index will be divided by 10.
The index, which is made up of the 49 most traded stocks on the Sao Paulo bolsa, was created on January 2, 1968. The last adjustment in the Bovespa index occurred in February 1994.
Futures index contracts and index options, which are based on the index, will also be affected.
On Friday, the Bovespa index closed at 88,287 points.
